about.title: About Me
about.bio:
I'm Wilson Sousa, a Backend Software Engineer based in Brasilia, Brazil. I specialize in engineering high-concurrency distributed systems and scalable microservices, focused in Python (FastAPI, Django) and Hybrid Cloud Architectures.

I have a proven track record of optimizing system performance from reducing storage infrastructure costs by 97% through compression, to deploying production-grade API ecosystems. I'm experienced with database tuning (PostgreSQL, ClickHouse), asynchronous programming, and building RAG systems with LLM integration.

Currently pursuing a B.Sc. in Computer Engineering at Universidade de Brasilia (UnB). When I'm not writing code, I'm exploring new technologies, contributing to open source, and sharing what I learn through my blog.

job1.description: Engineered a massive-scale scraping and ETL pipeline for 96 Brazilian tribunals, ingesting 300M+ records. Achieved 97% storage compression (7TB to 180GB) with ClickHouse on bare metal. Built a RAG system with Django and Vector Search to process legal documents (5k+ pages per file).

job2.description: Developed web scrapers for US Bank Data with Python, a geolocation-based Point Recording System using Next.js and Nest.js, and a University Teacher Evaluation backend. Also operated as Business Director managing the software lifecycle for 20+ clients.

job3.description: Engineered 'Natural Fluency,' an AI language tutor with real-time web browsing and dynamic lesson generation. Optimized a Django/PostgreSQL monolith for large-scale data exports and spearheaded integration of 12+ new languages into the platform.

job4.description: Developed Python and Shell scripts to automate routine server maintenance (backups, provisioning), saving the team 6 hours/week. Provided technical support for hardware and software infrastructure for government systems.
